body.name: StarTech.com 16in (40cm) 9 Pin Serial Male to 10 Pin Motherboard Header Slot Plate - motherboard Serial Port Adapter (PLATE9M16), Gray
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Add an extra serial port to the back of your PC from your motherboard
body.description: This 9-pin Serial to 10-pin Header Slot Plate adapter features one DB9 male connector and one IDC10 connector. The adapter is constructed of high quality components and expertly designed to ensure durability and reliability. Please refer to the Technical Specifications to ensure your motherboard is compatible with this product.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Easy to use and install This 9-pin Serial to 10-pin Header Slot Plate adapter features one DB9 male connector and one IDC10 connector. The adapter is constructed of high quality components and expertly designed to ensure durability and reliability.

Applications Add an extra serial port to the back of your PC from your motherboard Connects to your motherboard and adds an additional serial port to the back of your PC. StarTech Packaging Look for StarTech Branded Packaging to ensure you are getting a genuine StarTech product. What's in the Box 1 - 16in (40cm) 9 Pin Serial Male to 10 Pin Motherboard Header Slot Plate. Features 1* DB9 serial expansion port and bracket

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This works well with a new ASUS motherboard
reviews.reviewText: I plugged it in the com port on the motherboard and it worked the first time I tested it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great DB9 serial port when you need it
reviews.reviewText: I have an old APC UPS that I wanted to continue using (it has new batteries and plenty of power and then some for my setup) after upgrading the motherboard in my PC. Unfortunately, it only supports basic signaling over a standard serial connection.Sadly, the motherboard didn't offer a serial port on the back (I don't think any do these days) but it did have a db9 serial header on the motherboard. This connector solved my problem, allowing me to easily connect the internal db9 serial header to an external db9 serial port, allowing me to connect my UPS so that I could automate power-off situation handling on my desktop.I'm very happy that I was able to get this part to solve my particular need. I imagine that this is more of a niche part these days but I was very happy to find it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Work and Play
reviews.reviewText: Added this to an AM4 ATX motherboard to console into switches and devices. Worked as intended. The motherboard was the "MSi MPG B550 Gaming Plus." Will plan to buy another and add it to the kids computer so I can troubleshoot switches from there. USB com options would work, but sometimes they go bad on me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2011
reviews.reviewText: Had to buy this because I needed a serial port. Motherboard has only the 10-pin internal socket. This unit installed in 5 minutes and gave me what I needed: Linux found the device attached to the port upon restart.I like that the flat cable is plenty long. Should install in just about any motherboard/case combination.ATTN newbies: always power off your system before installing a PCI or other internal card. This ain't USB.Also, find or download your MB/system user's manual and get familiar with the BIOS setup. There's nothing hard about the physical installation of devices like this -- unless space is a problem -- but they do _not_ "just work," the motherboard has to "turn them on" at boot time and then tell the operating system (1) they exist and (2) how to communicate with them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It fits and it works
reviews.reviewText: Despite serial ports being less and less used, I still have a need for a hardwired one (as opposed to the USB serial dongles). My motherboard has a connector for this, but they don't include the cable. This one works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars longest serial cable I could find
reviews.reviewText: This is a pretty basic part that I got to extend the ASUS motherboard connector at the front edge to a port on the backside of the case. Most cables are pretty short; this was the longest one I could find as a ready-to-use item. It is just long enough to span the distance in a semi-tidy routing. I would rather it were a few inches longer, but the main thing was to connect some "legacy" radio gear with having to source the individual parts. So this part worked fine to get that task done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not quite sure how something like this could fail. The motherboard pinout seems to be pretty standard these days. If your MB has serial on it, this is the drop dead simple way to get at it. The only thing better is the two port version (if your MB *has* two ports .... some do).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Installed in a new windows 10 system with a 10-pin motherboard header for a COM port. I can use it easilly with my serial printer.

reviews.reviewTitle: 9 pin Serial interface nach dem modernen AT/EVEREX Standard - Umlötanleitung auf DTK, siehe Text
reviews.reviewText: Serielle Schnittstelle, wie sie seit ca Pentium-Zeiten besteht. Die Verkabelung ist 1-1. D.h. MoBo-Pin 1 ist an DB9 Pin 1 gelötet, pin 2 an pin 2, usw.Wer das Kabel an einem älteren Rechner betreiben möchte und feststellt, dass hier nichts raus kommt, wird es umlöten müssen. Der Standard heisst hier DTK/Intel und ist wie folgt:Kabel Pin -> DB9-Stecker Pin1 (rot) -> 12 -> 63 -> 24 -> 75 -> 36 -> 87 -> 48 -> 99 -> 5TL;DR: abwechselnd eins oben, eins unten, angefangen bei 1-1, dann alternierend.Das Kabel lässt sich problemlos, Grundkenntnisse vorausgesetzt

reviews.reviewTitle: Startech.Com Piastra Slot 16'', 40 Cm da Seriale Maschio 9 Pin a Header Scheda Madre 10 Pin
reviews.reviewText: Prodotto ottimo, si installa in un attimo e fa benissimo il suo lavoro. Il prezzo è conveniente rispetto ai negozi.Spedizione e consegna perfetti come al solito!
Item works great and fits perfectly. But I guess it's It's pretty hard to mess up something this simple.
Conectar y usar, es tan sólo una extensión desde el conector de la placa base, para poder conectar dispositivos en el exterior de la carcasa. Sencillo y funcional.
Reçu avec 3j d'avance sur date de livraison annoncée (envoi en lettre verte = pas de suivi)testé OKa recommander
